ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How old were you the very first time you had an episode of depression or  low mood and related problems lasting 2 weeks or longer?
About how many different years in your life did you have an episode of depression or  low mood and related problems lasting 2 weeks or longer?
How many months in the past 12 did you have an episode of depression or low mood and related problems?
Notes: Count all the number of months

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Trouble concentrating on things (e.g., reading the newspaper, watching television)
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Moving or speaking so slowly that other people could have noticed or being so fidgety or restless
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: How difficult has your low mood and related problems made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people in the past 2 weeks?
Notes: 1= Extremely Difficult; 2= Very Difficult; 3= Somewhat Difficult; 4= Not Difficult At All

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of the following problems? Little interest or pleasure in doing things
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of the following problems? Feeling down, depressed, or hopeless
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of the following problems? Feeling bad about yourself, that you are a failure, or have let yourself or your family down
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of the following problems? Thoughts that you would be better off dead or of hurting yourself in some way
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Trouble falling asleep, staying asleep, or sleeping too much
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Feeling tired or having little energy
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: In the past 2 weeks, how often were you bothered by each of these other problems? Poor appetite or overeating
Notes: 0= Not At All; 1= Several Days; 2= More Than Half the Days; 3= Nearly Everyday

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Notes: e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Form used/assessment name
Notes: e.g., Self-Report, Parent Form, Short Form, Revised Version
